intro: Brachystegia lufirensis, commonly known as the Lufira brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae and is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and smooth, grayish-brown bark. The leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of elliptical leaflets, and the tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by pod-like fruits. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and plays a significant role in the ecological structure of its habitat.
